author: dzhuliana
title: Bring more women to Cardano
description: Чтобы мир работал лучше для всех, наше сообщество должно отражать разнообразие мира. Менее 5% членов сообщества - женщины.

f6_assessments.q0: Seems like a great proposal to bring a Women focused Mentor/Mentee platform to Cardano for a 4 month trial. It would be nice to have some idea of what the plan would be after the trail period. Will this require ongoing funding? Is the level of funding required linked to the number of users, or is it just a platform cost with low marginal cost of delivery per user and thus scales well?
f6_assessments.q1: The proposers have a business providing this service already. The plan is well set out with clear goals and there is every expectation they will be able to deliver.
f6_assessments.q2: The prospers have put forward a well laid out plan with clear milestones and goals. Progress will be simple to audit. Goals suach as increasing the number of women led proposal should be relatively easy to audit, though there could be issues if proposers aren't required to submit their gender on the applications. Similarly with the goal of increasing the number of women on the Cardano network, how do you even measure the number of people on the Network, let alone their Gender. They do have some clear goals on number of recruits to the platform in the trial period (60) and the intention to track 30 matches.

f6_assessments.q0: The best way to be energized and feel connected is to help someone else. As for meeting the challenge brief, this proposal is spot-on. It delivers amazing value into Project Catalyst by increasing diversity and providing personal support for people who can then make great things happen.
f6_assessments.q1: The team is top-notch. The plan is amazingly well detailed and clear. The product itself is ready so it's easy to scale to the Cardano community. Finally, the team is utilizing a partnership with AIM in a clever fashion. Unstoppable success guaranteed.
f6_assessments.q2: The problem statement "To make the world work better for all, our community must reflect the diversity of the world. Less than 5% of the community are women" is coupled with a solution that answers the problem directly. The only thing that I would reconsider is the ambition level. 10% increase is a good start but once the ball gets rolling I'm hoping to see much more from this team.

f6_assessments.q0: With the development of the human world, not just with off-chain activities, now we should make more conditions for women to go on-chain and develop this new world as this team will do. The team has some desired goals that I believe will inspire a lot of women and other people to join the developed communities. Both the KPIs and the goals in the proposal show that this team is really concerned about the challenge givens.
f6_assessments.q1:
This proposal is full of info that can help Catalyst community has a well understanding of what they want to get in the future, and also the detailed steps to get it. Including vision, activities, features of the platform, they want to make and relevant skills for executing all these things. 
So on, they have a detailed budget that is reasonable with the roadmap and the detailed plan.
The only thing I concern in this project is some obstacles that they can meet in the way do it, they should think and have some plan for them.
f6_assessments.q2:
The team is skillful in writing proposals so it's completely full of info for auditing the project. 
This team also has good awareness about the problem and they really care about it, so that's the reason why their implementation plan is so detailed and fulling of needed info for developing it.

f6_assessments.q0: Aiming at improving network and participation of women through mentorship into the Cardano Catalyst, because less than 5% of the Cardano community are women. Having women working on projects can help shape a better future. How to encourage more women to join Cardano, and how to engage more women within the Cardano Community has been the matter to address. The challenge is effectively addressed by the proposal.
f6_assessments.q1: Among their plan mentioned are to research and know the current number of women in the Cardano network; contact those women   and invite them to become mentors; women in Cardano sign up as mentors and /or mentees, etc. as outlined in the proposal. The team consists of Program design experts, startup business development, technical lead, software engineer etc. to make implementation successful.
f6_assessments.q2: As stated, they want to achieve 10% increase of women engagement in Catalyst within 12 months; The budget is well broken down for effective implementation.

f6_assessments.q0:
* The proposal identifies a huge problem we all are facing in the Catalyst ecosystem (and tech in general): poor diversity. The solution aims to bring in more females. Dealing with diversity topics for 7+ years I learned how valuable it it to have different perspectives in the table. In this case the proposal misses a huge opportunity in not stating the benefits for all teams in order to better understand each other inside the team, the customer, the markets, the investors, etc. This is also the reason why it does not really fir into the challenge setting from my point of view. 
* If we would get more proof that the existing mentos have the needed skills and experiences in order to help our funded teams grow by adding the female side in the diversity area then it would be a different topic and offer the scalability for upcoming funds. I ask the proposers to rework the outlined parts and apply again in this challenge or with the same proposal (but more details in the feasibility and audibility section) in the (hopefully to be approved) diversity challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer presents an existing AI-match-making solution which is to be applied to the Cardano ecosystem. We get an action plan how the 4 proposers are going to spend the budget. We get enough proof about the four people in order to justify their experience building and running a system as outlined. The budget is broken down into packages per role. It would be great to get more information why we need each role for the full 4 months. We also do not know which party are already there and what has to be adopted. Being in the software development sector for +10 years I ask myself why the maintenance is as expensive as the development.
We do not learn the skills and experiences of the mentors, how we motivate them to participate, how we pay them and how our projects benefit from more female power. It would be great to get more information about it. What I like are the KPIs which first measure and then increase by 10%, which sounds realistic to me.
f6_assessments.q2: The platform development part is clear regarding problem, solution and actions. What could benefit from more information is to get more details why it is equally expensive to run the software as developing it. What remains completely open is the mentor part: What is there, what expertise do they own and how can the community benefit from it, besides increasing the female part.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal wants to improve participation of women within Catalyst proposals through mentorship. This is a great idea and falls within the challenge setting, and will have a positive impact on the Cardano Catalyst ecosystem. The KPi's of the challenge is met by increasing the amount of mentors and projects that it will bring to Catalyst.
f6_assessments.q1: The Team is set out with all their experiences and skills, and LinkedIn profiles are provided. They will also be working with the AIM team making this a strong team. The budget is set out step by step and seams reasonable. The Roadmap is set out over 4 months with actionable plans set out in the Action Plan, describing step by step how the project will be tackled. Resources are discussed, But I do not see risks discussed.
f6_assessments.q2:
As Mentioned above, the KPi's of the challenge is met by increasing the amount of mentors and projects that it will bring to Catalyst.
The Road map can be used to see if they are on track. They do not discuss where the voters and community members will be able to follow the progress though.

f6_assessments.q0: Not only does this project meet the challenge goals, but it also targets a key demographic that is incredibly needed within the Cardano community. Cultivating a diverse community is incredibly important and helps distinguish ourselves from other crypto communities.
f6_assessments.q1: This proposal shows that the founding team is incredibly experienced. This proposal is incredibly in-depth in terms of the project roadmap, KPIs, budget breakdown and information on the target demographic. This information shows the effort that they will put into the project.
f6_assessments.q2: The KPIs, budget breakdown and project roadmap show how the funds would be utilized. Due to this transparency, the project is highly auditable.

solution: Привлечение большего числа женщин в сеть Cardano и расширение участия женщин в проектах Catalyst за счет наставничества.
experience: Основатели существующей глобальной программы наставничества для женщин с механизмом подбора. В сотрудничестве с другими разработчиками Cardano и AIM.
